channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Democratic Party Is Getting Too Rich to Win
item.description: Democrats used to be known as the party of the poor and the working class. Two decades of federal income data show how that changed.

item.title: Elon Musk defends $1 trillion pay package: ‘I just don’t feel comfortable building a robot army here and then being ousted’

item.title: Bank boss says the Gen Z job crisis is real—they did what society asked, got degrees, and still face rejection: ‘They’re not built to withstand that’

item.title: Melania Trump memecoin team ‘weaponized fame to disarm diligence’ in sprawling crypto conspiracy, alleges court filing
item.description: A new legal filing reveals new details of an alleged memecoin scheme involving the First Lady.

item.title: Why pricing is now a top strategic priority for CFOs
item.description: Ninety-five percent of finance chiefs have adjusted their pricing strategies in the past six months, a Deloitte survey finds.

item.title: Here are the 4 pillars of Trump’s growing crypto empire—and the key people running the show
item.description: It’s widely known the Trump family is cashing in on crypto, but few people are aware of how their business operations are structured.

item.title: Oil Price Jumps on Trump’s Russia Sanctions
item.description: Traders are pondering whether the United States and its allies are finally getting serious about restricting Russian energy.

item.title: U.S. May Seek United Nations Mandate for Gaza Security Force, Rubio Says
item.description: Vice President JD Vance spoke from Israel, as he wrapped up a visit aimed at shoring up a fragile cease-fire between Israel and Hamas.

item.title: She Worked on Tsunami Alerts. Then She Was Fired.
item.description: “I always wanted to be a public servant and do science for the good of the people,” said Corina Allen, who lost her job at NOAA.
